key_channel_insights.line_content: OTA fares largely maintain parity with ~67% matching the airline's site, although ~26% are missing.
Over 70% of fares are cheaper on MSE, with minimal same-price listings and improved fare coverage.
Nearly 68% of GDS fares are above direct website pricing, with minimal undercutting observed.

conclusion.line_content: This report provides a high-level summary of the price discrepancies observed across different channels.  It is important to note that the data contains many nuances depending on various factors such as market conditions, booking windows, and the competitive landscape. Understanding these subtleties can be critical in optimizing pricing strategies and ensuring competitive positioning.

As part of our 'PriceEye' solution, we are developing an intuitive dashboard designed to help your airline's analysts drill down into this data. This tool will allow you to uncover and focus on critical actionable insights, enabling your team to make data-driven decisions with confidence.

We are here to support you in leveraging these insights to enhance your revenue management and distribution strategies. Please don't hesitate to connect with our team for more information about how PriceEye can assist you in achieving your business objectives.

ota_highlights.line_content: Roughly two-thirds of fares matched the airline’s website in the last week, indicating stable parity on most itineraries.
About a quarter of website fares were not found on the OTA last week; in some segments it peaked near 38%.
When differences occur, OTA is only 2–5% of itineraries. However, premiums can reach 20–30%, while discounts hover around 10–12%.

ota_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: Last week, 26% of fares were missing on this channel, though this rose notably in certain regions.
Parity remains dominant (67% last week), suggesting consistent alignment with the airline’s site.
Only around 2–3% of fares, with price cuts averaging 10–12% below the airline’s website.
Seen in roughly 5% of fares, carrying a premium of around 20% over official site pricing.

ota_summary_by_region.line_content: 68% matched the airline’s site, 26% not listed, and 3% priced higher with a 30% premium.
58% matched last week, 25% unavailable, but 14% showed higher OTA fares, generally 4–5% above the airline.

ota_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: 67–68% had matching fares, while OTA higher was minimal (3.5%) yet commanded a 35% premium.
65% matched, 7% were higher with a modest 10% premium, suggesting mild fare elevation outside Portugal.

ota_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: 65% of fares matched, 27% not found, and 5% carried a 21% premium compared to the airline’s direct pricing.
71% parity, 24% unlisted by the OTA, 4% higher with an 18% markup, and minimal discount activity.

mse_highlights.line_content: Over 70% of observed fares were cheaper on MSE compared to direct site, with a ~2% to 3% rise vs last month.
About 24% of direct fares were missing on MSE, reflecting a 13% drop from the prior week.
Same-price instances remained under 4%, suggesting minimal fare matching.

mse_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: Stands at ~24% last week, down 13% from the prior week, indicating improved MSE coverage.
Remains low at ~3%, exhibiting negligible week-to-week movement.
Accounts for ~1% to 2% of fares, with marginal growth of ~0.58% from last week.
Dominates at ~71% of listings last week, up nearly 12% from the prior period, averaging a ~6% lower fare.

mse_summary_by_region.line_content: 74% of fares are MSE-lower, up 12.4% week over week, with an average discount near 7%.
54% of fares are MSE-lower, up 6.2%, while 8% are priced higher on MSE.

mse_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: MSE-lower fares at 74.08% last week, climbing 12.84%, and virtually no higher pricing.
66.67% MSE-lower, up 9.7%, but MSE-higher stands at 2.88%.

mse_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: 70% of fares were cheaper on MSE, up 11.72%, with around 6% cost savings.
73% of listings are MSE-lower, up 11.34%, offering a similar 6%-7% price advantage.

gds_highlights.line_content: Over two-thirds of analyzed GDS fares are priced above the website, with minimal lower fares.
Fare unavailability in GDS hovers around 24% this week, reflecting a drop of over 13% from the previous week.
Where GDS fares are higher, the premium remains small, averaging around 0.20% for short-haul routes and 0.12% for long-haul.

gds_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: Nearly a quarter of website fares are not listed on GDS, down significantly from the prior week.
Around 7% of fares match the website, with flat week-over-week variations.
Close to 68% of GDS fares exceed the website, climbing nearly 14% since last week.
Less than 1% of fares undercut the website, with minimal week-to-week fluctuation.

gds_summary_by_region.line_content: GDS fares price higher over two-thirds of the time, with limited lower-priced occurrences.
Over 70% of fares are above website levels, and no significant undercuts are observed.

gds_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: About 69% of fares trend above the website, with lower fares rarely seen.
GDS fares are 67% higher than website listings, slightly less than PT but still dominant.

gds_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: About 68% of fares exceed website prices, with not-found rates dropping by 13% from last week.
Close to 69% of listings are higher than online fares, showing an 11% rise over the previous week.
